    Add a Sample App with Okta

    Contents

    • Introduction
    • Create the Application in SPGateway
    • Configure the Header Application Settings
    • Configure the Header Application Attributes
    • Add a Custom Attribute to Okta
    • Complete the Header Application Configuration
    • Test the Sample Header Application

    Introduction

    The purpose of this tutorial is to walk through the process of setting up a sample header application with Okta through the SPGateway Admin Console.

    The following is required:

    • Admin login for SPGateway Admin console.

    • SPGateway appliance configured with Okta tenant.

    • Access to and ability to modify local hosts file.

    Create the Application in SPGateway

    1. Navigate to the Admin UI for your SPGateway instance (for example, https://admin.icsynergy.info).

      SPGateway creates a default self-signed certificate. For non-production deployments, this will be appropriate. Proceed past any security exceptions raised by your browser. For production deployments, a valid certificate can be installed and these exceptions are not be needed.

    2. In the SPGateway Admin Console, enter your login credentials and click Login.

      Username: admin
Password: <default password>

    3. Click the Applications tab.

    4. Click +Add to add a new application.

    5. Select the SPGW Sample Header App option from the left column menu, and click Create.

    Configure the Header Application Settings

    1. Click Next.

    The Settings page provides options with which to further configure the application. For more information on the application setting options, Application Settings.

    Configure the Header Application Attributes

    1. Click Next.

    The Attributes page provides a list of attributes that will be passed into the application. This page also provides the ability to add, edit, or remove any attribute. For more information on the attribute options, see Application Attributes.

    Add a Custom Attribute to Okta

    1. In a new tab, navigate to your Okta Org, log in as an administrator, and click Admin.

    2. Navigate to the Directory → Profile Editor Section.

      You can hover over the main tabs in the Okta admin console to reveal the flyout sub-menus.

    3. Click Profile in the Actions column.

    4. Click + Add Attribute to add a custom attribute that will be used to send header information through the Sample Header Application.

    5. Enter Gender for the Display name and gender for the Variable name.

    6. Click Save.

    7. Click Directory → People.

    8. Select your account under the Person & Username column.

    9. Click the Profile tab, and click Edit.

    10. Scroll down to the Gender attribute, and enter a corresponding value.

    11. Click Save.

    Complete the Header Application Configuration

    1. Return to the SPGateway Admin Console.

    2. In the Attributes section, hover over the + button and click Session.

    3. Scroll down to the Add new Session Attribute window.

    4. In the Name field, enter gender, and select the gender attribute type in the Value field.

    5. Click Okay.

      In the Value menu, type in the name of the attribute you want to add, and then click the new attribute in the dropdown menu.

    6. Click Next.

    7. Click Done.

    8. Confirm that the Sample Header App is displayed as Active in the Protected Applications list.

    9. Click the Goto App icon.

      Ensure that the Public Domain defined in the Configure the Header Application Settings is added to local host file or DNS Server pointing to the VM running SPGateway. 
      <ip address>     <app public domain>
xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx  header.icsynergy.info

    Test the Sample Header Application

    1. Select IDP Initiated from the dropdown menu to verify the application is working.

      If you do not already have an active session for Okta open in your browser, you may be prompted to log in to your Okta account and provide your credentials.

    2. In the application page, review and verify that the Sample Header App sent to Okta match your profile information.

    Dec 10, 2018 by ICSynergy Staff
